WidgetContent.5d8a62ac-6cfa-4d98-8caa-82427838e19b:
[{"Id":"74ac2733-2e3d-4f63-9ae7-04dcb1ae39b9","Key":"Content.Text","Text":"

Congratulations on installing your Videre CMS.


The logon control should be displaying below.  Simply enter the user/password you used during installation and you will be on your way to administering your portal.

 

","Type":4,"PortalId":"3be22049-d6d5-477a-b1f9-bd929a38499f","Locale":"","Namespace":"__5d8a62ac-6cfa-4d98-8caa-82427838e19b"}]
WidgetContent.209c8d17-078c-41ed-9241-afb6f9203667:
[{"Id":"e0e603c8-8c2a-471f-b821-cf925cbc6efb","Key":"Content.Text","Text":"

Now that your logged in, there are a couple quick tips you should be aware of

  • You can administer the content of some widgets (like this one) by right-clicking on the text.  This will show a context menu giving the ability to edit your content.
  • There are two types of templates:  Layout and Page.   A Layout Template is responsible for defining the panes (rows/columns) for your widgets.  A Page Template is comprised of a Layout and one or more endpoints (urls).
  • Widgets can be placed on a Layout Template or a Page Template.  The  image in the footer is an example of a widget placed on the layout, as it is shared by all pages with the General Layout Template.
  • Widgets can be shown based off of Authentication status of the user.  This includes: Authenticated,  Not Authenticated, and None.  An example of this is the Logon widget is only displayed to Not Authenticated Users, whereas this Text/Html widget is displayed only to Authenticated users.  Finally, a widget can be shown based off of a user's role.
","Type":4,"PortalId":"3be22049-d6d5-477a-b1f9-bd929a38499f","Locale":"","Namespace":"__209c8d17-078c-41ed-9241-afb6f9203667"}]
